title: Software Engineering Intern
about: Joined the CT image generation team in charge of the implementation and optimization of algorithm designs submitted to us by our CT research teams.
Took ownership of a neglected Python internal tool aimed at the profiling and analysis of CPU/GPU performance and memory usage data across a cluster of machines.
Improved the distributed profiler's reliability to passing 48-hour stress runs by implementing changes such as switching communication channel to sockets, among many others.
Developed familiarity with working within a >1million LOC C++ and Python codebase.

title: Software Engineering Intern
about: Joined the main development team behind GE's private cloud called Edison Health Link.
Created an API meant to expose to the caller (a microservice deployed to EHL) the underlying hardware configuration hosting that microservice.
Implemented the API in Node.js, Express and deployed it as its own microservice to our Kubernetes cluster.
Learned Devops fundamentals (I have since completed the CKA certification).
